report_title: Olive Oil Production in the US
executive_summary: After a decade of strong growth, the Olive Oil Production industry has begun to stabilize and settle over the past five years. Statistics from the California Olive Oil Council (COOC) indicate that California is involved in 74.6% of total production, indicating that the volume of olive oil produced in the state has grown drastically over the past two decades. Olive oil is an increasingly popular food product, and domestic food producers have decided to take on production themselves rather than rely fully on imported olive oil. However, tariffs placed on imports were met with reciprocal tariffs placed on olive oil exports from the United States, resulting in a contraction of the domestic

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Statistics from the California Olive Oil Council (COOC) indicate that the volume of olive oil produced by its members has doubled every two years for the past decade. The organization's members make up more than 90.0% of California oil producers, and California makes up 74.6% of US production. The International Olive Council (IOC) estimates that the United States will produce about 16,000 tons of olive oil in 2020, up from 4,000 tons in 2015, indicating the rapid expansion of the Olive Oil Production industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry contraction due to trade disputes and pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: However, the trade disputes initiated by the Trump administration, as well as disruptions related to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic during the second half of the current period, have produced significant disruptions to growth, especially to industry exports. Consequently, IBISWorld estimates that the industry has contracted an annualized 0.8% to $82.3 million over the five years to 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Projected revenue growth after pandemic recovery
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With the expectation that trade relations will continue to normalize, IBISWorld forecasts that revenue for the Olive Oil Production industry will grow at an annualized rate of 2.4% to total $92.8 million over the five years to 2026.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increasing demand from rising disposable income
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2021, IBISWorld estimates that consumer disposable income will increase at an annualized rate of 2.5% as the economy continues to expand following the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. With this increase, consumers will be better able to purchase olive oil, stimulating demand.
Still, US producers will seek out export markets and attempt to compete with Mediterranean producers. Exports are expected to rise an annualized 3.8% to total $23.5 million in the five years to 2026.

industry_definition: This industry makes edible oil out of olives, including different grades like refined olive oil, virgin olive oil and extra-virgin olive oil. Generally, olive oil producers retail products to wholesalers, supermarkets and online retailers.
key_trends: Olive oil has received significant media attention for its health benefits
While domestic production has taken a larger share of the market, US consumers still rely on imports
More stringent labeling has been one of the ways the industry has become increasingly structured
Publicizing olive oil's health benefits will continue to provide an opportunity for the industry
The United States will likely remain the world's largest import market for olive oil
Questions of quality control and labeling will continue to pervade industry discourse

market_segmentation.segment_description: Large supermarket chains and convenience stores generate 62.0% industry revenue and serve as the most important points of purchase for consumers.
Exports are expected to account for an estimated 23.7% of industry revenue in 2021.
Grocery wholesalers account for 9.8% of industry sales in 2021, but their share is reducing as large chains bypass them.
Food service industries like restaurants account for 4.5% of revenue in 2021.

products_and_services.product_description: Extra-virgin olive oil has the highest quality and is the most flavorful olive oil classification.
Olive oil is a blend of refined olive oil and virgin olive oil with different blends using more or less virgin oil.
Refined olive oil is produced by refining virgin olive oil and is typically tasteless, odorless and colorless.

tier_1_buyers: Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for olive oil is driven by trends in consumer tastes and preferences regarding health and nutrition.
There has been growing awareness of the health benefits of olive oil over the past five years.
Demand for olive oil is sensitive to price changes and disposable income levels.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports are expected to account for 96.1% of domestic demand in 2021, totaling $1.6 billion.
While domestic production has been making a dent in domestic demand, imports still far outweigh domestic production.
Exports had been rising but recently declined due to tariffs imposed on other countries resulting in reciprocal tariffs on US products.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has the highest percentage of both establishments (around 35%) and population (around 25%).
The Southeast region follows with around 20% of establishments and around 25% of the population.
The Southwest region has a relatively lower percentage of establishments compared to its population share.
The Mid-Atlantic region accounts for around 15% of the population but only around 10% of the establishments.
New England has a relatively lower percentage of establishments compared to its population share.
The Great Lakes region has a relatively lower percentage of establishments compared to its population share.
The Plains region has the lowest percentages for both establishments and population.
The Rocky Mountain region has the lowest percentages for both establishments and population.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The EPA enforces acts like the Clean Air Act and Clean Water Act to limit pollutant discharge from the industry.
The FDA enforces regulations on food labeling, nutrient claims, and hazard prevention to protect public health and safety.
Some states like California have implemented standards defining different grades of olive oil based on acidity levels.
The CDC has released guidelines for businesses related to COVID-19, such as employee health screening and safety precautions.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Potential operators must have significant capital for larger production facilities to achieve economies of scale.
Established major players have relationships with wholesalers, distributors, suppliers and customers for lower distribution costs.
The industry is labor intensive, so new entrants must attract skilled labor which is a significant cost.
Advertising and established branding is a barrier as consumers are reluctant to adopt new unknown brands.

factors_increased_barrier: Industry assistance level is low and increasing
Globalization level is high and increasing
Competition level is high and increasing

basis_points.basis_description: Companies hold a significant competitive advantage if their products perform in line with their advertising claims.
Price is a significant basis of competition given the homogeneity of industry products.
Operators need to invest in marketing and promotional initiatives to differentiate themselves and establish brand recognition.
Developing and maintaining strong relationships with key suppliers like olive farmers is critically important for success.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Only one producer holds more than 5% market share, and the two largest account for 30.8% of industry revenue in 2021.
The industry is fairly young and few companies have expanded enough to gain large market share.
Most operators are small and the number of new entrants is increasing, adding to high competition.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Olives are the main raw material inputs industry operators require.
Companies manage price risk by entering into sales contracts, which generally consider price fluctuations.
While automation typically results in lower labor costs, more advanced equipment requires skilled employees that receive higher wages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Olive Oil Production industry has a low to moderate level of capital intensity. The industry spends $0.08 on capital for every dollar spent on labor.
While some operators use machines to harvest olives, many producers harvest olives either by hand or with small hand-held tools.
Operators also use machines to crush olives into a paste, and then use a centrifuge to separate the oil and water from the pulp.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue growth is driven by economic factors like disposable income levels and consumer trends like health consciousness.
Trade disputes initiated by the Trump administration and disruptions from COVID-19 have caused significant revenue fluctuations in recent years.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry has adopted mechanized harvesting methods and automated temperature/oxygen control in processing to improve efficiency and quality.
Techniques like super high-density cultivation enable faster olive production from trees.
The deodorization process used illegally by some producers to remove defects squeezes profits for legitimate producers.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: The vast majority of olive oil consumed in the US is imported

FAQs.question: Have export opportunities offered an opportunity for your company?
FAQs.answer: Exports have grown significantly as a share of revenue for most US olive oil producers

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Most olive oil producers grow their own olives keeping better control of costs

FAQs.question: Is your company located in proximity to important suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Most olive oil producers operate in states where they can more easily grow olives

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology, such as [example: RFDI tags, etc.], in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Olive oil producers can utilize new technology to better manage supplies

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation is a growing aspect of olive oil production

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Olive oil producers often work with the International Olive Oil Council

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth recommendations? How many of your clients were referred to you by a satisfied client?
What is your historical performance in meeting consumer expectations? What is your current reputation and how can you improve it?
How is your company involved in international trading?
